pullRequest.body:
This defines derivations on Lie algebras. The current definition of [Derivation](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/RingTheory/Derivation/Basic.html#Derivation) is restricted to commutative associative algebras, and thus cannot be used to manipulate derivations on Lie algebras. As discussed in [this Zulip thread](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Derivations.20on.20Lie.20algebras), we thus give a parallel definition of a `LieDerivation` structure, which is specific to derivations on Lie algebras.

This PR is focused on the definition of this structure and the first associated properties. It adds a new file `Algebra.Lie.Derivation.Basic` which was mostly obtained by a large copy-paste of file `RingTheory.Derivation.Basic`. I report below the changes I made with respect to this other version.

- Remove all `#align` directives
- Adapt import statements
- Add new definition of `LieDerivation`
- Replace `namespace Derivation` with `namespace LieDerivation`
- Remove `open Algebra`
- Replace `Algebra A` with `LieAlgebra L` everywhere
- Replace `Derivation R A M` with `LieDerivation R L M` everywhere
- Delete field `map_one_eq_zero'` in instances, since we don't require it in the definition of Lie derivation
- Adjust `simp only` tactics for `leibniz'` field in instances
- Add lemma `apply_lie_eq_add` to restore usual Leibniz rule in Lie algebras (since our definition relies on left actions, so has a minus sign).
- There is no unit 1 in a Lie algebra. We delete all related theorems
  - `map_one_eq_zero` (there is no 1 in a Lie algebra)
  - `map_coe_nat` (there is no "n : Nat" in a Lie algebra)
  - `map_coe_int` (there is no "n : Int" in a Lie algebra)
  - `leibniz_pow` (there is "power" in a Lie algebra)
  - `leibniz_of_mul_eq_one` (there is no [a,b]= 1 in a Lie algebra)
  - `leibniz_inv` and `leibniz_invOf` (no inverse in a Lie algebra)
  - `map_algebraMap` (no scalars in the Lie algebra)
- Derivation has an `mk'` constructor to bypass the `map_one_eq_zero'` field in an `AddCancelCommMonoid M`. Since we don't require this property for Lie derivations, we delete everything related:  `mk'`, `coe_mk'`, `coe_mk'_linearMap` (the whole `section Cancel`) 
- Derivations have a theorem `eqOn_adjoin` to prove that if two derivations are equal on a set, they are equal on the subalgebra spanned by this set. We write it as `eqOn_lieSpan`. Since the proof of this result relied on an induction principle `RingTheory.Adjoin.Basic.adjoin_induction`, we needed a similar principle for Lie spans. We added it as the `Algebra.Lie.Submodule.lieSpan_induction` theorem in the `Algebra.Lie.Submodule` file.
- Add a `SMulBracketCommClass` class to encode commutativity of scalar multiplication and left Lie action (as a substitute for `SMulCommClass S L M`), see `section Scalar`. Introduce instances for `S = Nat` and `S = Int`.
- Unwrap useless section, useless variables
- Delete `compAlgebraMap` theorem, related with a tower of algebras, since a Lie algebra cannot serve as a scalar field for another one.
- Delete `section Pushforward` (and everything inside), as it was related to composing an A-linear map with a derivation. While this works when A is an associative algebra, one cannot use a Lie algebra in this role since it is not associative.
- Could not figure out what the equivalent instance of `IsCentralScalar S (Derivation R A M)` for a Lie derivation should be, so I skipped this instance.

nodes.body: Thank you for this first review. I think that I have accepted and/or fixed each item.

:v: frederic-marbach can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
borse merge
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8514196253/job/23319435568)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8514196253/job/23319435434)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8514196253/job/23319435277)

This is looking great, I've made a bunch of small suggestions. Once these have been addressed I might have one or two more nitpicks but we can merge this quickly after you've had a chance to respond to my initial review.

Thanks so much for joining the Lie theory effort!

Please apply the suggestions and then feel free to merge.

bors d+

```suggestion
Copyright © 2024 Frédéric Marbach. All rights reserved.
```

```suggestion
Authors: Frédéric Marbach
```

```suggestion
This file defines *Lie derivations* and establishes some basic properties.
```

Slightly more is true:
```suggestion
instance instLinearMapClass : LinearMapClass (LieDerivation R L M) R L M where
  map_add D := D.toLinearMap.map_add'
  map_smulₛₗ D := D.toLinearMap.map_smul
```
Note that I have also explicitly named the instance; this is not necessary but we usually prefer to do this, partly of because of https://github.com/leanprover/lean4/issues/2343


For emphasis, I note that given the above, we have the following:
```lean
example : AddMonoidHomClass (LieDerivation R L M) L M := inferInstance
```
(NB this `example` is just for illustration and should not be added to the source.)

```suggestion
theorem toFun_eq_coe : D.toFun = ⇑D := rfl
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
instance instCoeToLinearMap : Coe (LieDerivation R L M) (L →ₗ[R] M) :=
```

These are all available via the general lemmas which require only a `LinearMapClass` instance
```suggestion
```
(indeed one of the main reasons for these `LinearMapClass` typeclasses is to save duplicating these lemmas everywhere)
As above, we don't need to duplicate this lemma.

I deleted this lemma in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11790/commits/89ff1eed87abd8df329366fabe1a9f329c7378de.

`BigOperators.map_sum` seems to only require an `AddMonoidHomClass`, which we also have for the usual derivations. So shouldn't this lemma also be deleted there too? I created a very small dedicated PR https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11827

We won't ever need this: `LinearMap.CompatibleSMul` only useful when the coefficients `R` don't have negation.
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```

Optional nitpick:
```suggestion
instance instZero : Zero (LieDerivation R L M) where
  zero :=
    { toLinearMap := 0
      leibniz' := fun a b => by simp only [LinearMap.zero_apply, lie_zero, sub_self] }
```

```suggestion
instance instAdd : Add (LieDerivation R L M) where
  add D1 D2 :=
    { toLinearMap := D1 + D2
      leibniz' := fun a b ↦ by
        simp only [LinearMap.add_apply, coeFn_coe, apply_lie_eq_sub, lie_add, add_sub_add_comm] }
```

In the `Derivation` theory we have the possibility that the scalars `R` are only a `Semiring` and so the file is split up into sections according to whether or not additive inverses exists. I don't think we should do that here since in Lie theory we have simplified and always demanded an additive inverse (i.e., we always have `CommRing R` and never `CommSemiring R`).

With that in mind I think the `Add (LieDerivation R L M)`, `Neg (LieDerivation R L M)`, and `Sub (LieDerivation R L M)` instances (and their API) should all be adjacent to each other, and in the same section.

Thanks for the explanation. I fixed it in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11790/commits/321b0fdec3e08750203325fefd1d50caeef0ec8b.

I also removed the `AddCommMonoid` instance since we have and `AddCommGroup` one. It must however stay after the scalar multiplication section because it somehow requires a multiplicative instance by integers.
As stated above, I'd place this adjacent to the `Add` instance.
Fixed in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/11790/commits/321b0fdec3e08750203325fefd1d50caeef0ec8b too

Style nit:
```suggestion
instance instBracket : Bracket (LieDerivation R L L) (LieDerivation R L L) where
  bracket D1 D2 := LieDerivation.mk ⁅(D1 : Module.End R L), (D2 : Module.End R L)⁆ (fun a b => by
    simp only [Ring.lie_def, apply_lie_eq_add, coeFn_coe,
      LinearMap.sub_apply, LinearMap.mul_apply, map_add, sub_lie, lie_sub, ← lie_skew b]
    abel)
```

I suggest dropping this: the day we would use this is very distant (if it ever comes):
```suggestion
```

```suggestion
instance instLieAlgebra : LieAlgebra R (LieDerivation R L L) where
  lie_smul := fun r d e => by ext a; simp only [commutator_apply, map_smul, smul_sub, smul_apply]
```

We use `⊂` for stict inclusion only:
```suggestion
/-- If a predicate `p` is true on some set `s ⊆ L`, true for `0`, stable by scalar multiplication,
```

Noticed one more style nit:
```suggestion
instance instSMul : SMul S (LieDerivation R L M) where
  smul r D :=
    { toLinearMap := r • D
      leibniz' := fun a b => by simp only [LinearMap.smul_apply, coeFn_coe, apply_lie_eq_sub,
        smul_sub, SMulBracketCommClass.smul_bracket_comm] }
```
(to be clear: what you have is fine --- I just prefer this)
